ticket.title: Support for infinity from database in validates_numericality_of
ticket.original-body:
After this patch was accepted
https://rails.lighthouseapp.com/projects/8994/tickets/354-allow-infinity-to-pass-validates_numericality_of
infinity was partly supported by validates_numericality_of. However, if the infinity (or nan for that matter) stems from the database, the validation would fail. That leads to the rather interesting cases where the model is successfully saved, but a reloading and saving again fails because of validates_numericality_of. I have create a patch that solves the issue. (attached).
Note that support for infinity in the database is broken, at least for postgresql; I will create an issue an attach a patch for this later.

I have create a patch that solves the issue. (attached).

version.body-html:
After this patch was accepted

https://rails.lighthouseapp.com/projects/8994/tickets/354-allow-inf...

infinity was partly supported by validates_numericality_of. However, if the infinity (or nan for that matter) stems from the database, the validation would fail. That leads to the rather interesting cases where the model is successfully saved, but a reloading and saving again fails because of validates_numericality_of. I have create a patch that solves the issue. (attached).

Note that support for infinity in the database is broken, at least for postgresql; I will create an issue an attach a patch for this later.

version.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not been commented on for at least three months.
The resources of the Rails core team are limited, and so we are asking for your help. If you can still reproduce this error on the 3-0-stable branch or on master, please reply with all of the information you have about it and add "[state:open]" to your comment. This will reopen the ticket for review. Likewise, if you feel that this is a very important feature for Rails to include, please reply with your explanation so we can consider it.
Thank you for all your contributions, and we hope you will understand this step to focus our efforts where they are most helpful.
version.body-html:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not been commented on for at least three months.

The resources of the Rails core team are limited, and so we are asking for your help. If you can still reproduce this error on the 3-0-stable branch or on master, please reply with all of the information you have about it and add "[state:open]" to your comment. This will reopen the ticket for review. Likewise, if you feel that this is a very important feature for Rails to include, please reply with your explanation so we can consider it.

Thank you for all your contributions, and we hope you will understand this step to focus our efforts where they are most helpful.
